Ask HN: How can I become a Forbes 30 under 30?
text:
As a kid, my goal has always been to be on the Forbes list of 30 under 30, and I have 10 years left to achieve this goal. But I keep asking myself if I am doing enough.

4 years ago, I taught myself how to code and got started instantly, mostly contract jobs that turned out into big opportunities.

3 years ago in my first year of college at 17, in order to get more contracts, I created a software development agency and made websites for local businesses in my area.

1 year ago I transitioned from the agency business into my first marketplace company, an auction marketplace. I was losing money on small sales from payment processors and ads, as I had promised the users a 0% buyer's premium. I was also the main seller, so I was selling at a loss when the auction closed. The business was closed at the beginning of this year.

This year, I transitioned from the auction marketplace, to create a market research app that's based entirely on polls and the data we gather from people voting. Then I also got a job to keep funding these projects.

What should I be doing better to hit my goal in 10 years, I feel like I am on the right track but missing something else entirely.

title: Ask HN: What tools do you use to make your website/browser interactions faster?
text: I'm a long time Mouse & Keyboard user. However, as of late, I've been working away from home more frequently, I'd hate to bring a mouse and mousepad to a coffee shop for a number of reasons so I've been interacting with webpages primarily using my laptop's trackpad and chromium's mediocre keyboard shortcuts. Does anyone have a setup for faster, ideally keyboard-based website interfacing?

Ask HN: Is there a Firefox extension for persisting a viewport, even fullscreen
text:
There are hundreds of ways to uniquely identify a user visiting a website.

I'm focusing on the screen/device type area: Screen dimensions, refresh rate, dpi, and user agent.

Firefox and Chrome both support a feature in their dev tools, where you can adopt the screen dimensions of a common phone or tablet model.

Is there a Firefox extension that allows this "viewport" to be enabled all the time? I'd love to know that no matter what dimension I set my Firefox window to, or when fullscreen, it's always rendering a 1920x1080 "generic" viewport within it. All it needs to do is make it comfortable for me to pan around/zoom in/out.

I haven't seen an extension quite like this.

(Thank you)
